properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event will continue through the weekend into next week. Inland from the Great Lakes, daytime high temperatures near 29 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the low to mid thirties, are expected over the next several days. Overnight lows will range from 16 to 20 degrees Celsius with the coolest temperatures near the Great Lakes. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-05T11:46:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T19:47:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2683870311.2020
Area: Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island, Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-05T01:57:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T21:48:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2236310140.2020

properties.Title: High Water Advisory Alert Issued For The Red River Between Emerson And The City Of Winnipeg
properties.Summary:
Description: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Red River between Emerson to the City of Winnipeg due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-07-10T16:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-07-04T14:55:59-05:00, F165BC83-5FBF-3CEA-6E2C-4B49F2290DE3
Area: The Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Tornado Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm that is producing a tornado. At 4:34 PM CST the public reported a tornado. At 4:34 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this tornadic thunderstorm was located about 15 km northeast of Kincaid and was moving toward the southeast at 20 km/h. In addition to a tornado, this severe thunderstorm is capable of producing baseball-sized hail and wind gusts in excess of 120 km/h. At 4:05 PM the public reported softball-sized hail southwest of Glenbain. ### This is a dangerous and potentially life-threatening situation. Tornado warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-04T23:53:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T22:37:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0344234593.2020
Area: R.M. of Glen Bain including Glen Bain, R.M. of Pinto Creek including Kincaid and Hazenmore, R.M. of Wood River including Lafleche Woodrow and Melaval
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 34 are expected for the next 2 days. A hot and humid airmass persists over much of east central Manitoba. Cooler temperatures will enter the area Sunday night. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-05T12:07:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T20:08:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1286458397.2020
Area: Molson Lake and Bear Lake, Cross Lake and Jenpeg, Wabowden, Hwy 6 between Little Limestone Lake and Ponton, Norway House, Oxford House and Gods Lake, Red Sucker Lake, Island Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and frequent lightning. Radar is indicating multiple clusters of thunderstorms over eastern New Brunswick. Potentially dangerous conditions will continue south of Miscou Island to western Northumberland Strait between into the evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-05T01:03:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T20:29:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3831308182.2020
Area: Chaleur - Miscou, Northumberland Strait
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:09 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This storm is currently near Brightsand Lake and is heading to the northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-04T23:56:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T21:10:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3917024962.2020
Area: R.M. of Mervin including Turtleford Mervin and Spruce Lake
